review: This is such an easy to use and necessary accessory to anyone that has a Macbook Pro, IPad or even Iphone.  The picture looks fantastic!  And it takes up very little space and uses almost no electricity.  Our Blu-Ray Player has not been turned on since we hooked up Apple Tv.  A couple of things to note before buying this product:1.  You must update your Macbook Pro Operating System to Mountain Lion to use it with Apple TV.  Mirroring will not work otherwise.  There is a cost of $20 to do this update and it will change your computer in many ways (including slowing it down and taking longer to boot up).  However, after using cords to connect my computer to my tv, I will take the bad qualities of Mountain Lion anytime.  The sound comes through crystal clear, picture is great.2.  Mirroring does not look very good coming from IPhone or IPad 2.But there are so many great things about this.  We are purchasing a surround sound system since it picks up the shared music on my itunes.Netflix looks great and HD comes through wonderfully.  I also love the "Remote" app on my iphone, which allows me to control the apple tv from my phone.  No need for a remote!!!! My wife and I can both have our own remotes and control the music, shows and pictures at the drop of a hat.With technology, comes convenience and this product made my life a lot easier.Thank you Apple
author: dickpimento

review: We got in our Apple TV and set it up instantly! The apple TV allows for access to Netflix and Hulu from the device through an app on there. I also found it was cheaper to just buy some of the seasons I love on iTunes than to have a bigger Dish package just to have that one channel so it has allowed us to save something like 200 dollars a year by looking at what we could buy or rent through iTunes and the channels and shows we currently watch. Hulu has access to tons of shows including the CW. We did have a slight hickup in doing the airplay from my MacBook Pro 2012 with the updated software. The CW website was having serious lag problems when it came to the TV screen. YouTube was also a little lagging from the computer to the TV screen through AirPlay. That is before I found the part where there's a YouTube app on the apple TV so you can simply search and show stuff through the device itself. I highly recommend looking at YouTube for people showing the device before you buy just so you know what it can do.In order to do AirPlay we did have to upgrade out software on our Macbook Pro 2012 but our "New" iPad's are already compatable and do the AirPlay brilliantly. One other addition when the iPad was hooked up the "shown screen" or the picture we were getting on the TV screen was smaller than the computer and when we just used the product itself. We have a wide screen TV. So it shrunk our TV quite a bit. You do have to pay for Netflix and Hulu if you want to use the services. Also I'll add in how the iTunes works. All your purchases are on there and accessible, but if you buy a season pass the show will show up one day later to be able to view. For example, my guilty pleasure Beverly Hill Housewives show's on the television on Monday's but I can't watch the show through iTunes until Tuesday. I think it's Tuesday at like midnight or early in the morning but it's always the next day even for American Horror Story. Hope this helps those that are curious about the apple TV.
